65629366310.title: Concept Space vs Action Space
65629366310.summary: A look into what happens when we mix up descriptive categories with prescriptive ones. Problems from the same category may still have different solutions, and recognizing the similarities is insufficient for a solution.

65627266310.title: Fading Novelty
65627266310.summary: Fading novelty is when new things become old and dull after repetition. From foods to songs, we notice its presence. It also makes it harder for us to learn and practice certain skills.

65630566310.title: Good Self-Help Is Self-Defeating
65630566310.summary: Self-help is supposed to get people to stop needing it. But the typical incentives in any medium mean that it's possible to get people hooked on your content, rather than learning from it.

65630666310.title: Recognizing vs Generating
65630666310.summary: Two core ways to categorize tasks are Recognizing and Generating. Though they may seem initially similar, they differ in the effort involved. This dichotomy is explains which ways of solving a problem are effective and which ones are just paying lip service.
